It's a shame the Giants are being proactive and probably going to sign Jake Long at LT since he is in for a second visit, while Elway and this coaching staff are going to put a patch work O line together and make that weakness a bigger weakness with what they are trying to call an O line. Kubiak's system hasn't ever done good unless the O line can block and the RB excels. Anderson is good, but hasn't proved he can be good against 7 and 8 man boxes or even draw them to open the passing lanes and slow the pass rush from a fear that he can actually break loose for a big gain. It is irresponsible to not bring in a higher regarded veteran while he is there just bc you want to bring young guys along. If those young guys don't perform at a high level and don't do their job then Elway and the head coach has failed the Broncos, Manning, and the fans. If they try this with young guys and it doesn't work and there is nobody to get that we could've got when Clady went down then it will say that this front office and coaching staff are nothing special and not capable of analysing talent and needs on this team. The O line was already the biggest question, now it is more of a question. Most of America can realize and already realizes that this O line is pathetic and are scratching their heads wondering what the new coach and Elway are doing. It is a shame to not have somebody ready that can perform at a high level if TY can't which is most likely the outcome based on the college game for the combine. Chris Clark already showed you can't rely on him so there is nobody for LT bc TY is too weak. Clark got pushed around and allowed pressure within a half second against the Seahawks. Yes, he's going to be a cocky rookie. It happens all the time when the big college studs come to the NFL and have the spotlight on them, but it doesn't last long. 

Cam Newton was one of the worst until he got picked on and destroyed by defenses. Especially Von Miller. Von pretty much ended Cam's cockiness with one amazing game and definitely one of Von's best games haha.  But now Cam has calmed down and acts like a Pro, that I know of. 

Shane Ray could come in cocky this season and get torched by opposing offenses and deflate his ego to bring him back down to Earth, which would be good cause then he'd train even harder to avoid that happening again. Or he might come in cocky and make his presence on the field known in the NFL and win Defensive Rookie of the Year. All I want from him is to get better and better and help us win games.

I'm still so excited to see him and Von going after the opposing QB together. If Shane transitions really well into the NFL, Miller and Ray will be one of, if not the best and scariest duos in the NFL. Imagine two Von Millers on the field at the same time, both of them competing against each other (friendly competing) to get more tackles, sacks, INTs, forced fumbles, TDs, etc. and to get better, faster, and stronger with each game that passes. data.name: Sundays with Sacco: Manning always gives back

data.message: This is what being a role model is all about. He is a professional. He has integrity. He aims to do his best each and every day. It's a joy to watch him play. So many have said it before and I will say it again. I â¤ï¸ Peyton Manning.

Peyton is a Mohican, the last of a dying breed of high-character athletes in the NFL.  I have been a Broncos fan since 1977 and was ready to give up on them and the NFL right before Peyton arrived in Denver because of all the low-class acts. I, along with many other fans, will quit lining the pockets of these thugs when Peyton retires.

Peyton is such a giving person. I have watched him in college when he played at Tennesse. He played for years for the Colts and now the Broncos. It has been a joy to watch him mature and reach all the achievements that he has accomplished. Nothing compares to all the things Peyton has done off the field with no recognition needed. He is an inspiration and probably one of the most humble people I can think of. Peyton Manning is a class act and a hero in my eyes. Just look at the wonderful contribution he made to the fallen Marines and sailor. Need I say more.
Peyton Manning is one of a kind!!!  He is a wonderful role model for all the younger people in our world!!!  We love Peyton & all the Manning  family!!!
Denver is so BLESSED to have you Peyton Manning!
Absolutely love Peyton Manning very classy man above and beyond in everything he does.
Peyton a Manning is not only one of the best quarterbacks in the NFL, he is the best role model for the NFL.  The Christ in him is shining.

Peyton is the definition of CHARACTER.  I believe this came from the way he was raised by Mom & Dad.   Morals & family  values lead to great things.  Thanks Archie & mom for sharing Peyton with us.  GO Broncos!!!!
As  Bronco fan who grew up in Denver, & a proud resident of Chattanooga, Peyton Manning's generosity is nothing new to us, it's only surprising when the news leaks out to national attention.

Peyton is the reason I love football. I started watching back around 02 and was searching for a team when I found the Colts and Peyton. I had my team. True story...I wore my Manning jersey to work the day they released Peyton. My boss let me go home. I was too depressed. I was sitting at a red light when a garbage truck pulls up next to me. The guys look over and are laughing at me as I'm crying in my car listening to the press conference in my #18 jersey. I don't care. Peyton is the best representation of a sport I love! I am still a Colts fan as I feel you have to stay with the one who brought you BUT I watch every single Broncos game and I just might have a #18 jersey in orange....forgot to add that my dog is Peyton 1-8.
Great article.  Peyton Manning is truly a role model.  Unfortunately, few today can say that about themselves.
It's nice to see someone in NFL being a great role model, it's refreshing compared to all the other stuff you read during the offseason of players getting in trouble. Class act!
Broncos are Blessed to have Peyton Manning!!   <3.  :D
I love Peyton Manning he always gives back
those who receive much give much in return. God Bless Peyton Manning.
I love Peyton Manning, he is a great quarterback and I love my Bronco's, I have been a Bronco's fan since 1969, and I still am an avid fan

He done the right things to get where he's at today nothing half assed he also had great teacher's his dad good coaching and of course John elway I bet a lot of people don't realize how close the NFL almost lost elway over draft picks if the Colts would have picked him he was going to play baseball thank god for the Denver Broncos John elway and Peyton manning and the rest of the team mates its there time this year
Peyton Manning is a one of a kind, we are blessed to have him on our team, as well a member of our community!

No truer words have ever been spoken regarding the man, Peyton Manning. As a Tennessean, and a huge Manning fan; we, here in Knoxville, are well aware of his giving heart, and love of country. Thank you for this fantastic post...I plan to share it with ally friends on FB!
Been a Peyton Manning fan since his days at UT. Glad to read the faith I have in him is well placed. So seldom does it seem fiiting in today's athletes.

For those who say he should be cut, you clearly don't understand the state of the Broncos d-line. Comparing him to Jackson is also pretty dumb. The point was to have Jackson and Wolfe both starting, so Jackson being better or worse than Wolfe doesn't matter at all. We don't have a proven solid replacement for Wolfe on the roster, so we'll need him back as soon as possible.

At this point I'm so fed up with Elway's inability to draft not a single starting O lineman that can stay at the position that this suspension doesn't carry that much weight. Every other successful GM drafts O lineman in the First round and at least O lineman that can start and are strong enough to start unlike TY. Our O line is so horrible it's pathetic to call it an O line for a NFL team. The O line has hindered us and got worse each year, and Elway can't draft a starter and he can't sign a starter now that it's worse than ever. You can't expect signing one RG to keep the whole O line floating. Even before Clady's injury, Clady himself said he was performing sub par. There were plenty of reasons before then to address the O line. Peyton Manning is the best QB in NFL history. Elway needs to get an O line for Manning. Manning has carried all his team's and done it with less. He has made receivers and TE's while playing QB, O line, and Offensive Coordinator at the same time. He has done it with no run game, poor O lines, not the best coaches but not all were bad either, and played most of his career without a good defense. data.name: Countdown to camp: New look O-line

data.message: Sounds like a bunch of guys that are starting for an average college team! This is pathetic and poor management to not invest more in the O line and risk it dragging the team down again, and hindering the team. Manning has to do enough playing QB and carrying the team without a lot of help in years past. He shouldn't have to play O line and QB at the same time as he has had to do. It's a shame to assemble this team and to have to much pride to admit you have failed to build a starting NFL caliber O line and let that keep you from bringing in NFL starting caliber O lineman instead of a bunch of backups and weaker guys like Ty who was picked in the 2nd round with a 4th to 6th round grade that will get ran over in a half second. Ty was rated lower bc he is to weak for the NFL right now and couldn't even hold up against tougher college division talent in the senior bowl. NFL talent will break him and hurt the team. Trade Brock for a starting LT while you have him to trade and have people thinking you actually think he is worth something and hope that acting like Brock is getting better will do enough to get a trade bc we all know how bad he is when facing starters in the season, it seemed like he got sacked or had a bad play every time except for the one Manning told him to throw to Green in garbage time so that Green would catch a TD. You pay Shelley Smith a backup 2.5 million a year and more than he was making who isn't a starter and tried to make him one. Traded a 4th rounder and pay over 1.5 million for the worst center in the league and didn't start last year and played a hand full of snaps bc of it.

They treated our recruiting squadron like we were family, and on many occasions at marketing events we were allowed to set up shop right next to the "Colts in Motion." Peyton was Peyton. In the meantime I've been watching baseball, highlight clips from the last few seasons, my favorite Bronco, Steve Atwater, destroying the Nigerian Nightmare over and over again, and finding/buying new Broncos onesies and other gear for the new addition to wear during her first season as a Broncos fan! Two days ago we did some family pictures and the little lady and I took some with our Broncos gear on. I found out that she loves having Broncos stickers put on her face, but hates having them taken off!

How did I get by during the off-season??? OK so here it goes the offseason started off by my wife Jessy Cooper and myself planning our wedding which happened to be a Denver Broncos themed wedding,  it included a custom broncos jersey as our guest book a football field seating chart, tables named after past and present broncos players of course our colors were blue and orange, the bouquet toss was replaced with a broncos mini football and many other little things.   We followed up the wedding with our honeymoon which we decided to spend in Estes park on our way home to Ohio it was absolutely paramount that we stop at sports authority field for a tour which was awesome.   After returning home we started to plan out the season,  we've already got tickets for when Peyton and Co. Come to Detroit which is just a short drive north and are planning on making it up to Cleveland indy and Pittsburgh.  So with all of that being said the offseason was painful we can't wait for the season to start,  but we filled it with as much Denver broncos as we could.  GO BRONCOS!!!

As a working mom I have always had to have one foot in and one foot out of all that I love. My family comes first. This past season I converted my son to a full fledged fan. We made every Sunday a mother-son event. Going where the game was play or watching from home and buying "football snacks". In anticipation of the 2015 season I wear my Broncos shirt and custom made scarf to work on casual Friday. On occasion I borrow my son's - his is way cooler. I watched and read every FB post and interview.  From contracts to training ... I believe this is the season and this is the time. I could never afford such a trip ... but this would be the biggest boon ever!  One game at mile high ... would be a dream come true. I love manning but I've been Orange and blue since Elway!!! data.name: Ray's big move and big steps forward

data.message: Now go be a positive role model and take that back to the 'hood!

Hoping for big things from you as a Bronco Shane! For all your haters, there are plenty of us that believe in you and can't wait to see you step on field as a Bronco! We want to see you let the monster out on the field! Can't wait!

We need to make sure we get RB Nick Chubb from the Georgia Bulldogs next year in the draft no matter how soon we have to draft him or go up and get him. He would help Peyton Manning tremendously and can carry this team on his back just as he carries the Georgia Bulldogs on his back. So then you have Manning and Chubbs both that can carry this team on their back. That is a recipe for success. He can keep our defense off the field and fresh. The best defense is a great offense. We could score, run the clock down, and have so many weapons with Chubbs added to the team. I think with Chubbs along with our new additions this year and a few free agent additions or the right draft picks on the O line we could go head to head with any team with Chubbs at RB to help our QB that is hard to bring down and draws 8 man boxes, which opens the passing lanes while preventing a fully committed pass rush bc Chubbs demands that elite respect to where you can't just ignore the run game. Manning has and still can take down teams on his own, but with no O line he deserves help taking down teams instead of him having to do it on his own. If Manning had help like these other guys and like their teams give them, Manning would win the Superbowl each year, which means the Broncos would win it each year. It's frustrating that Elway hasn't provided Manning the help he deserves, and has him playing with no O line. If Elway would provide the right players and an NFL quality O line the Superbowl would be won each year by the Broncos as long as Manning decides to play. I think it's weird that the O line isn't fixed and possibly worse especially since everybody knows that the O line has hurt our team and held us back each year. Hopefully the O line system will do its job and Manning, Kubiak, and the Broncos will win the Superbowl this year. I wish Elway would sign everybody that could help this team this year bc this is a special Superbowl to win. Hopefully the coaches do their job and the players will do their job and help Manning and the Broncos will win the Superbowl this year. Our other RB's would compliment Chubbs well too. RB Nick Chubbs would be the one addition over everybody else that could be added that would help this team. You got to score points now and Chubbs would definitely help in that area with Manning at QB! If Gurley stays healthy who runs just like Chubbs and who Chubbs took over for when Gurley got hurt, Gurley will run the Rams into the playoffs each year on his back. Chubbs is younger and more durable, and got better while doing just as good of job at RB for Georgia last year. In my opinion Chubbs will be the better RB and the best in the league, and Gurley will be a close behind him if he stays healthy. Plus they both can pass catch. An elite RB helps the team in all areas and on both sides of the ball. It isn't often these type of backs come along and especially in back to back years. We have to get Chubbs next year, especially since we missed out on the other Georgia RB Todd Gurley that can carry a team to the playoffs on his back this past year. A RB that scores points, opens the offense up, slows and stops pass rushers, and keeps the defense fresh is more important and does more for the team than any pass rusher no matter how many sacks a pass rusher gets, bc that elite bell cow RB can keep that pass rusher off the field or neutralize his pass rush.

Every other GM concentrates on the O line each year and the few that haven't, started doing so the past couple years and even the Panthers and TB started working on it this year with true starting caliber players. Everyone has figured out that backup quality O lineman really hurt the team in so many ways. It hurts the team even when you have Manning that makes you for the lack of O line and is the only QB that could and does play behind the one he has had to pay with. He plays QB, the O line in pass protection, and even had to help them run block against the Chargers last year. That is a shame to send a professional team out there with what you're calling an O line. You should be embarrassed and ashamed that you can't put together a better O line than what you have patched together Elway. Stop worrying about 5 years from now when it won't matter anyway bc there will be no chance at a Superbowl after Manning retires, which I hope isn't for another 3 more years after this season.
